ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I broadened my knowledge of many grammar concepts in french as well as my reading, writing, and speaking skills.
My French writing improved immensely.
So. Hard.

- Solidified more complex grammar topics
- Deeper understanding of WWII & Frances role
- Expanded vocabulary
In taking this course, I developed my skills in both written, and spoken French language. I also gained insight into aspects of French culture.

Getting better at French. We discussed several grammatical structures, did comprehensive units on La Symphonie Pastorale, World War 2 and the Holocaust in France, and a small survey of some francophone literature.

This course was an amazing way to develop and hone in on my French skills. Whether it was grammar, speaking, or listening skills, class with Madame Burton was literally the best. I learned so much about French literature and history associated with Francophone countries.
Better reading comprehension and listening skills in French language.
This course really contributed to my ability to speak, read, and write in French.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class covers a lot of material, but at times, the amount of work seemed to be unnecessary.
Strengths: lots of variation in activities
It is so hard
Strengths: Professor Burton is absolutely phenomenal. The Sac de Billes curriculum and emphasis on speaking were also strengths.
One strength of this course is that it meets on a consistent basis, therefore aiding students to develop language skills every day. There are no obvious weaknesses of the course.

I think the biggest strength of the class was the breadth of what we covered--we spent time on literature, history, and pure French grammar without it ever feeling repetitive or unnecessary. The weekly actualites were fun and refreshing, and the exposes at the end were very informative. That said, I think it would be possible to streamline the ending of the class--or at least to redistribute that work. The month of April was extremely busy in this class, and I think rescheduling parts of it to even that workload across the semester would have been very nice.

You will have to dedicate a lot of time into this course. L4 is not a joke and, if youre not really interested in the language, you are not going to enjoy it at all. Madame Burton was honestly the best professor I could ask forits a true shame she wont be teaching this course in the future.

Strengths 
-great planning and enthusiasm from Mme. Burton
-appropriate levels of homework
-frequent feedback 

Weaknesses
-would have liked more opportunities to speak, but this was a function of our larger class size

I really appreciated how organized and structured this course was. The clarity of the syllabus and the course packet really helped me follow along with the material. I also appreciated how many extra resources were made available.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Very hard
No. Its so hard.
100%! Your French grammar and vocabulary will become much better while learning a significant amount about the French-speaking world

I would recommend this class to other students. I enjoyed the content that was taught throughout the class, and I feel I benefited from the exercises that we were instructed to do. For anyone looking to develop an understanding for more advanced French, I would recommend this course.

If it's something in which you are interested in and/or need for the language requirement, I'd recommend it. The general workload was about an hour a night and an hour and a half over the weekend, but toward the end of the semester there were a good number of projects and films that bumped it up. I think some of Madame Burton was wonderful at explaining the concepts and teaching them to us, and the fact that she was a native English speaker who learned French helped her greatly in teaching us.
I would absolutely recommend this course if you seriously want to learn French. Be prepared to spend a lot of time on the homework and other course requirements. L4 French is not a joke!
Yes, a great class and I feel my French greatly improved.
I would absolutely recommend this course to any student interested in learning French.
